Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant fulfilled the residence requirement under Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessment: Appellant's physical presence (232 days), maintenance of home in Canada, tax payments, promotion of Canadian interests abroad, extensive absences due to business in Hong Kong
Burden_of_Proof: On the appellant to demonstrate primary connection to Canada
Legal_Rule: Applicants must accumulate at least three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application; physical presence not strictly required if primary connection to Canada is demonstrated
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable in citizenship appeals
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet residency requirement due to insufficient physical presence and stronger connection to Hong Kong
Outcome_on_Merits: Appellant failed to fulfill the residence requirement
Review_Standard: De novo review of legal and factual issues
Key_Evidence_Considered: Duration of physical presence, tax records, ownership of home in Canada, business activities in Hong Kong, promotion of Canadian interests abroad
Applicant_Challenge: Demonstrating that absences were justified and that primary ties remained with Canada
Decision_Authority: Appellate division reviewing citizenship judge's decision
Outcome_of_Review: No change in original decision; appeal dismissed
Governing_Rule: Section 5(1)(c) requires minimum physical presence or demonstrable primary connection to Canada
